alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of western Calhoun, northeastern Kanawha, southeastern Wirt and Roane Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line of thunderstorms from near Spencer to Clendenin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Grantsville, Clendenin, Arnoldsburg, Amma, Reedy, Cherry, Tariff, Mount Zion, Walton, Left Hand, Lucille, Looneyville, Creston, Annamoriah, Gandeeville and Munday. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 15 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
